title: GRID
notes: Cannot return to game after alt tab, enabling higher resolutions (1920 x 1080) caused a pink screen. Setting aspect ratio to 16:9 appears to break sound permanently, even after changing back and restarting. Game crashes when attempting to actually play

title: GRID
notes: Needed to change hardware requirements file to enable 1920x1200 resolution, works, but sometimes crashes with "page fault on write access"

title: GRID
notes: Steam client freezes trying to start the game

title: GRID
notes:
Works completely nice with default settings.
But, on custom resolution game crashes on launch.

title: GRID
notes: Seems fine. Didn't have the crash on resolution change like another user.

title: GRID
notes: Tested on HP EliteBook 1040 G1; 1366x768 resolution, Ultra-Low graphics preset (all options Off/Low/Ultra-Low, based on availability). No workaround needed. No errors seen.

title: GRID
notes: Starts and runs very well, but randomly crashes to desktop.

title: GRID
notes: The game would not start in my native resolution. I deleted a line in hardware_settings_restrictions.xml which fixed it. (It seems to be a problem with the game on windows too)

title: GRID
notes:
By default the game was crashing when loading a race. Seems there may be some issues with the number of threads on modern CPUs so adding the following to the launch options fixed the game for me:"
taskset -c 0-3 %command% -novirtual
"
Also a known issue is with 64bit Windows which is fixed with the "-novirtual" parameter. Other issues might be resolvable using the general Windows fixes at: https://pcgamingwiki.com/wiki/Race_Driver:_Grid#Issues_fixed
